questions.question_text: Which of the following is the BEST reason for senior management to support a business case for developing a monitoring system for a critical application?

choices.C: The cost of implementing the system is less than the impact of downtime.
choices.A: The system can be replicated for additional use cases.
choices.B: An industry peer experienced a recent breach with a similar application.
choices.D: The solution is within the organization's risk tolerance.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
c all the way, d is more of a risk assessment , just because you can tolerate a solution, dont mean its free. it costs money, no company will spend money on a solution because they can "tolerate" it. C on the other hands is telling you hey, this app would cost us 10 dollars if breached, but it only costs 2 dollars to mitigate it.
just my two cents

Selected Answer: D
D. The solution is within the organization's risk tolerance.

Selected Answer: D
C doesn't take into consideration probability.

questions.question_text: Which of the following is MOST important when developing an information security governance framework?

choices.B: Integrating security within the system development life cycle (SDLC) process
choices.A: Ensuring alignment with the organization's risk management framework
choices.C: Developing policies and procedures to support the framework

questions.question_text: What should be an information security manager's GREATEST concern when an HR department outsources data processing to a cloud service provider?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
The greatest concern for an information security manager when an HR department outsources data processing to a cloud service provider should be the security posture of the provider (Option A). Ensuring that the provider has robust security measures in place is crucial to protect sensitive employee information from breaches and unauthorized access
